alert.note: Alert for Central Horry; Northern Horry (South Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Wilmington (Northeastern South Carolina and Southeastern North Carolina - Wilmington)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued April 14 at 1:27PM EDT by NWS Wilmington
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of western Brunswick, southwestern Columbus and central Horry Counties through 200 PM EDT... At 127 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Hickory Grove, or 8 miles northeast of Conway, moving northeast at 15 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Tabor City, Loris, Hickory Grove, Longs, Hammond, Goretown, Allsbrook and Loris Community Hospital. This includes SC Highway 22 between mile markers 12 and 22. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle. This storm may intensify, so be certain to monitor local radio stations and available television stations for additional information and possible warnings from the National Weather Service.
